ratings.comment: He's nice and knows his history, he's just not great at getting the information across. His powerpoints aren't helpful and the presentation he accompanies them with tends to get off topic or turns into rambling--half the time I wasn't sure what to write down out of what he was saying. Jumped from topic to topic. There was also lots of reading.

Class was enjoyable but not what I signed up for. Wasn't a survey of Caribbean history/society, instead focused on specific topics. Lots of reading. Several short papers with one long paper at the end. Professor was nice and helpful but left the class up to the students a lot. He definitely knew a lot about the subject so I wish he shared more.

Such a difficult class.  Discombobulated lectures and difficult to follow without prior knowledge.  Readings were long and complex and central to testing.  I have never been more discouraged and frustrated by a course.  Scarano is a nice guy who's very passionate about Puerto Rico and teaching, but severely overestimates how much background one has

As an auditor in this class I was never allowed to contribute to the class in any way. When I approached him about auditing another class the next term, he said "no" beacause I was too intimidating, due to my age, that I was not only older than their parents but the age of their grandparents. Due to my age I was not welcome.
A lot of weekly benchmarks with a final paper of 25 pages.  It wasn't easy, but Scarano is a nice dude that's willing to help, and definitely knows what he's talking about.

Scarano is really passionate about Caribbean history and very willing to help. He has a tendency to get off topic during lecture sometimes, which can be annoying. Quite a bit of reading, but mostly pertinent. I recommend the class in general, but especially for history majors who want to get their ethnic studies requirement done.
A lot of reading is required!!! not all of it is important though.

Sends out lec outlines but to really benefit you have to attend. RIDICULOUSLY lengthy readings and then on top of it you have to write reactions on all 3-5 of them per week which is pointless, didn't help me at all because according to my TA, I never got the point of them. He did help during office hours though

I was disappointed with this class.  I was initially very interested in the subject, but there is a ridiculous amount of reading with required reaction papers.  Although in all fairness Scarano is very passionate about the subject, it just wasn't what I had hoped for and made fulfilling the ethnic studies requirement a pain.
Good lecturer but when paired with Marquez there's trouble.  Marquez while quite the shoddy professor, Scarano balances him out.  The course is demanding.  I would personally not recommend it.
He's okay.  He's very helpful outside of class.

Professor Scarano does have favorites in class, but even though I wasn't one of them, I found him to be fair & helpful when I talked to him one-on-one.  I thought the class was really interesting, and I'd definitely recommend it to people who are interested in Caribbean history.
Always plays favorites in class, never organized for lecture & inconsistent grader, & very one sided in presentation.
Good teacher.  He may get off of subject occasionally, but it's part of his charm.  He speaks passionately and knows a lot about the subject.

He is a great professor, funny and makes the class fun and interesting. Although the class is a bit hard. He uses outlines but sometimes is a bit disorganize. He is a great person and if you show interest and are responsible he will help you as much as he can. I also took Chicla 330 with him and MArquez and it is pretty much the same.
Took this class a couple years ago in my first semester.  Still stands out as the worst course ever that I had at UW (most all were awesome, this instructor and the class were just rotten).
Disorganized & poorly presented.  When I went to his office for help, all he did was compliment me on my blonde hair & ask me if I worked out alot.  Just creeeeeeeepy!!!!!

AWESOME teacher, tho he did bounce around in lecture - I'd only take this class if you're truly interested. TA's were great as well, i enjoyed them more so than the lectures. Go to class if you expect any decent grade, in-class concepts are extremely essential in the midterms and essays!
No Comments
Great TA!
real fancy pants, holier than thou issues
Professor Scarano and the TA are so nice and helpful in this class.  If you don't attend lectures or discussion don't expect to do well, but overall it's a fairly easy class!
